nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -22,12 +22,13 @@ repos:
       - id: black
 
   - repo: https://github.com/asottile/reorder_python_imports
-    rev: v1.9.0
+    rev: v2.3.0
     hooks:
       - id: reorder-python-imports
+        args: [--py36-plus]

nodes.bodyText:
From commit message:
This way it'll update legacy imports automatically,
such as mock -> unittest.mock
and mypy_extensions.TypedDict -> typing.TypedDict.

I can imagine people leaving in accidentally copy-pasted from __future__ imports for instance. And people at a previous employer of mine were repeatedly confused and installing mock when it was already in the standard library.
